title: Social Entrepreneurship-Based Startup Education Competency Enhancement Program for Pre-Service Teachers

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced courses and extensive practical experience in specialized fields, foundational understanding of social systems and economic principles
context.additional_context: A program focused on equipping pre-service teachers with the ability to effectively deliver entrepreneurship education. It emphasizes designing education linked to social entrepreneurship and community development, exploring integration possibilities with social studies subjects like history, geography, politics, and economics.

learning_goals: The core elements of entrepreneurial education linked to social entrepreneurship (risk-taking propensity, motivation, locus of control, creativity) can be explained from the perspectives of social systems and civic education.

Learners design a 4-week entrepreneurship education program (8 sessions) targeting public/non-profit educational institutions, develop an operational plan incorporating social value creation and economic principles, and achieve at least 80% learner participation while meeting a satisfaction survey score of 4.0/5.0 or higher.
Develop and apply evaluation tools to measure the effectiveness of entrepreneurship education, and analyze the political, economic influence, and cultural suitability of the educational curriculum.

resources: LMS Platform (Lecture Videos, Quizzes, Discussion Board)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
